title: Is Oklahoma Trying To Return $2M Worth of Hydroxychloroquine?
subtitle: Gov. Kevin Stitt defended the purchase in April, saying the money spent "will not have gone to waste in any respect."
author: Alex Kasprak
vclaim: Oklahoma is trying to return a $2 million stockpile of hydroxychloroquine purchased in April 2020 at the request of Gov. Kevin Stitt.
